greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if n is a 4-almost prime, that is a product of exactly four (not necessarily distinct) primes, 0 otherwise.
comment: See A101638 for the inverse Moebius transform of this sequence.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Almost Prime.
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
example: a(100) = 1 because 100 = 2 * 2 * 5 * 5 is the product of exactly 4 primes and thus is a 4-almost prime.
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Dec 10 2004
